item.title: 2016 Tour – Day 4 Report
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Wednesday, 18th May – Whitsand Bay Recognising a lost cause when they see it, Wednesday saw the abandonment of the singles and replacement with a team “Pink Ball” challenge in groups of three. The sunshine of Looe was but a distant memory as the teams were confronted with weather that could be politely described as changeable. […]
item.content:encoded:
Wednesday, 18th May – Whitsand Bay

Recognising a lost cause when they see it, Wednesday saw the abandonment of the singles and replacement with a team “Pink Ball” challenge in groups of three.
The sunshine of Looe was but a distant memory as the teams were confronted with weather that could be politely described as changeable.
In fairness, the heavy downpours were very intermittent and could hardly be blamed for at least two of the groups losing their ball on the first tee shot of the day.
It may, however, have contributed to another group who chose to dispose of theirs towards the sea on the 6th.
Results
The team of Sue Pritchard, Martin Sykes and ace team player Pete Cosford were oblivious to all this mayhem. They returned with pink ball intact, carding a commendable 106 points which was easily enough to secure victory.
Spot prizes went to
NTP      10th      Martin Sykes
NTP      12th      John Pritchard
NTP x 2 13th     Nigel Wain
Longest Drive 9th  Dave Scott
The format for this day will, prior to next years tour, either be reviewed by a specially selected committee, or decided via referendum. Watch this space.

item.title: 2016 Tour – Day 3 Report
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Tuesday, 17th May – Yelverton The 2016 Open Championship was held at a new venue for most of the attendees this year. Overall, the scoring was good with more than half the field scoring 30 points or more. Out first, defending champion Robert Austen found the course to his liking setting a commendable target of 36 points […]
item.content:encoded:
Tuesday, 17th May – Yelverton

The 2016 Open Championship was held at a new venue for most of the attendees this year.
Overall, the scoring was good with more than half the field scoring 30 points or more.
Out first, defending champion Robert Austen found the course to his liking setting a commendable target of 36 points . In his group Dave Scott came up one point short despite scoring 23 points on the back nine. Closely behind came Pete Cosford and Nigel Wain on 34 .
Notable outward scores came from Nigel with 22, Rob with 21, Sue Scott with 19 and Bruce Mercer with 18.
Coming back,  Dave led the way with 23 with Richard 19 and Pete C 18.
Overall a victory for Rob retaining the trophy and being the first holder of the “Harris Hat of Glory”. This year, in a striking red colour.

Rob being congratulated by our host – Peter.

Results
Rob Austen                 21                        15                              36
Dave Scott                  12                         23                              35
Pete Cosford               16                       18                              34
Nigel Wain                   22                       12                              34
Richard Edmonds       14                       19                              33
Christine Mitchell       15                       17                              32
Sue Scott                     19                       13                              32
Bruce Mercer              18                       13                             31
David Wain                 14                        16                             30
Sue Pritchard             14                        16                             30
Spot prizes
NTP x 2  3rd  Rob Austen
NTP        6th  Rob Austen
NTP        12th  Paul Needle
NTP x 2  14 th Sue Pritchard
LD            18th Rob Austen  & ?
2 s  Dave Scott x 2 and Pete Cosford
In addition, a team event was won by Christine Nigel Martin and JP with a score of 81 points

item.title: 2016 Tour – Day 2 Report
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Monday 16th May, Whitsand Bay After the sorting of pairings via the new “Harris Hat of Glory”, the teams lined up at our home course for the week. Results went as follows Christine Mitchell bt David Wain 5 & 3 Pete Cosford […]
item.content:encoded:
Monday 16th May, Whitsand Bay

After the sorting of pairings via the new “Harris Hat of Glory”, the teams lined up at our home course for the week.
Results went as follows
Christine Mitchell           bt        David Wain           5 & 3
Pete Cosford                              Phil Reay
Derek Craston               bt          Peter Harris          3 & 2
Rob Austen                                 Sue Scott
John Pritchard            lost        Geoff Scott           1 hole
Reg Brown                                 Bruce Mercer
Sue Pritchard                bt          Dave Scott             2 & 1
Paul Needle                                Martin Sykes
Steve Mulford            lost         Nigel Wain              1 hole
Richard Edmonds                     Jane Wain
3 to 2 to the Craston team
Spot Prizes
No NTP winners on 3rd or 18th
NTP x2 on 15th     Sue Pritchard
L Drives  Bruce Mercer & Jane Wain
Afternoon Report
With an uneven initial number  of starters the normal Greensome format was replaced by teams of 3 playing Texas Scramble. This was later (ie. after they finished their beers…)  joined by a late entrant 4th team.
Victors with a gross score of 71 netting to 65.8 were the Harris team of Jane Wain, Pete Cosford and Peter Harris.
NTP on 10th wnt to Pete Cosford
NTP x2 15th John Pritchard
L Drive  we have no recollection
2s   Pete Cosford & possibly (probably) Paul Needle

item.title: 2016 Tour – Day 1 Report
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Sunday 15th May at Looe The big news was that this years tour started in sunshine!! After delays for some on the A38, play commenced as scheduled at 1pm with the first round of the team competition. Results Rob Austen bt […]
item.content:encoded:
Sunday 15th May at Looe

The big news was that this years tour started in sunshine!!

After delays for some on the A38, play commenced as scheduled at 1pm with the first round of the team competition.
Results
Rob Austen                     bt                Dave Scott           2 & 1
Richard Edmonds                              David Wain
Steve Mulford                 halved        Geoff Scott
Sue Pritchard                 with             Phil Reay
Derek Craston                bt               Sue Scott              5 & 4
Reg Brown                                        Martin Sykes
John Pritchard                bt               Peter Harris          5 & 4
Pete Cosford                                    Noigel Wain
Christine Mitchell           bt               Jane Wain             2 & 1
Paul Needle                                     Bruce Mercer
Craston team surge into the lead 4 1/2   to 1/2
Spot Prizes
NTP 1st     Richard Edmonds
NTP x 2  6th      Pete Cosford
NTP 12th          Paul Needle
L Drive 18th      Dave Scott & Christine Mitchell
2s Richard Edmonds & Peter Harris

item.title: Day 1 Pairings Announced
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Peter has drawn names from the Harris Hat of Glory and we can now confirm the following pairings for Looe Golf Club on Sunday 15th May. Dave Scott vs Rob Austen David Wain Richard Edmonds Geoff Scott vs […]
item.content:encoded:
Peter has drawn names from the Harris Hat of Glory and we can now confirm the following pairings for Looe Golf Club on Sunday 15th May.

Dave Scott          vs    Rob Austen
David Wain                 Richard Edmonds
Geoff Scott         vs     Steve Mulford
Phil Reay                      Sue Pritchard
Sue Scott            vs     Derek Craston
Martin Sykes               Reg Brown
Jane Wain           vs     Christine Mitchell
Bruce Mercer              Paul Needle
Nigel Wain          vs     John Pritchard
Peter Harris                Pete Cosford
The following spot prizes will be in play on the day:
1st   NTP
6th  NTP x2
11th  NTP x 3
12th NTP
18th Longest Drive

item.title: 2016 Trip
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: 2016 Trip Information Peter has confirmed arrangements for our tour next year. We’ll be staying at the Whitsand Bay Hotel. The itinerary is as follows: May 15th – Looe Golf Club (meet at midday for coffee and bacon rolls with a 1pm tee time) May 16th – Whitsand Bay Golf Club May 17th – Yelverton […]
item.content:encoded:
2016 Trip Information

Peter has confirmed arrangements for our tour next year. We’ll be staying at the Whitsand Bay Hotel.

The itinerary is as follows:

  • May 15th – Looe Golf Club (meet at midday for coffee and bacon rolls with a 1pm tee time)
  • May 16th – Whitsand Bay Golf Club
  • May 17th – Yelverton Golf Club
  • May 18th – Whitsand Bay Golf Club
